introduction: This video provides an overview of web servers and application servers, their differences, and their uses. It explains the role of web servers in hosting websites and the role of application servers in running web applications and providing processing power and memory for these applications.

sections.title: Section 1: Introduction to Web Servers
content: Web servers host websites, which are collections of web pages.
Web servers can be categorized as shared or dedicated based on the number of users and the amount of traffic.
Web servers can send HTTP responses directly if the requested URL is present or look into a static database for resources.
Web servers can also use servlets to process requests and fetch data from an application data store.

sections.title: Section 2: Introduction to Application Servers
content: Application servers are designed for running web applications and providing processing power and memory.
Application servers can manage virtual machines and hypervisors.
Application servers can interact with clients and process specific applications.
Application servers can provide an environment for running specific applications that web servers may not have.

sections.title: Section 3: Uses of Application Servers
content: Application servers are used for running web applications.
Application servers can manage virtual machines and hypervisors.
Application servers can interact with clients and process specific applications.
Application servers can provide an environment for running specific applications that web servers may not have.

sections.title: Section 4: Differences between Web and Application Servers
content: Web servers host websites and send HTTP responses directly or look into a static database.
Application servers are designed for running web applications and provide processing power and memory.
Web servers can interact with clients and process specific applications through servlets.
Application servers can manage virtual machines and hypervisors.

sections.title: Section 5: Conclusion
content: Web servers host websites and can send HTTP responses directly or look into a static database.
Application servers are designed for running web applications and provide processing power and memory.
Both web and application servers can interact with clients and process specific applications.
Web servers can manage virtual machines and hypervisors, while application servers can provide an environment for running specific applications.
